intro: Banara costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican banara, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as tropical forests. Banara costaricensis is valued for its ornamental qualities and has some traditional uses in local communities.
